page.title: 20The 'new' schools
page.content: Nearly all children between 5 and 16 years old go to either the primary or the comprehensive schools in Easingwold.Those from outlying farms rely on their own transport, otherwise there are school buses running through Raskelf.Children were generally happy with their schools, parents sometimes were worried about the size of schools today.The comprehensive has over 1200 pupils which is felt to be a massive change for those who went to the old village school.Another view was that those who wanted to do well did so, but those who needed pushing might get firmer treatment somewhere else.A value of the comprehensive was felt to be the facilities it provided for evening classes, a youth club and swimming in the summer holidays.
